** simple \textcolor
.
\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{xcolor}

\definecolor{red}{rgb}{1,0,0}
\definecolor{red}{rgb}{1,0,0}
\definecolor{red}{rgb/cmyk}{1,0,0/0,1,1,0}
\definecolor{red}{hsb:rgb/cmyk}{1,0,0/0,1,1,0}
\definecolor[named]{Black}{cmyk}{0,0,0,1}

\definecolor{myblack}{named}{Black}

\definecolorset{cmyk/rgb/hsb/gray}{}{}%
 {cyan,1,0,0,0/0,1,1/.5,1,1/.7;%
  magenta,0,1,0,0/1,0,1/.83333,1,1/.41;%
  yellow,0,0,1,0/1,1,0/.16667,1,1/.89;%
  olive,0,0,1,.5/.5,.5,0/.16667,1,.5/.39}


\begin{document}
This is \textcolor{magenta}{kind of red} text.
\end{document}
.
<div class="body">
<p>This is  text.</p>
</div>
.
